description: Dive into nostalgia by exploring a collection of children’s books at a library or bookstore. Relive the magic or discover new favourites!
Host an ice cream tasting party with 5 different Ben & Jerry’s flavours, paired with a binge-watch of a regal series like The Crown or your favourite comfort show.
Give back to your community by volunteering at an animal shelter, charity shop, food bank, local park, or museum. It’s rewarding and inspiring!
Challenge your creativity at the zoo by capturing unique photos: zoom in on a lion’s mane, highlight the texture of a gorilla’s knuckles, or snap the elegant curve of a flamingo’s neck.
List 10 things you’re grateful for, from big achievements to small joys. Ready for a challenge? Set a timer and aim for 100 or more!
Take a refreshing swim, whether at your local pool or a wild swimming spot. Bonus points if you go for an invigorating outdoor plunge!
Boost your mood with laughter by watching a comedy special, a witty panel show, or your favourite sketch series. Let the giggles flow!
Create a family tree on a big sheet of paper. Include your relatives, imagine a fictional family, or map out the connections of your favourite characters.
Declutter your space by filling four large bags: two for donations and two for rubbish. Pump up the music and turn it into a decluttering dance party!
Be a tourist in your own town! Explore local shops you’ve never visited before. You might uncover hidden gems or find unexpected treasures.
Plan a colour-themed day: dress in one colour, eat foods of the same hue, and create art inspired by it. Let the colour guide your creativity!
Revisit an old hobby you loved but haven’t done in a while. Dust off your knitting needles, dig out that camera, or pick up that long-forgotten sketchbook.
Take a mini road trip to a nearby town or village you’ve never visited before. Explore, take photos, and grab a snack from a local café!
Cook or bake something new and adventurous! Try a recipe from a different culture or put a twist on a classic dish you love.
Have a picnic—but with a twist! Host it indoors with a blanket on the floor, or create a themed menu to make it extra special.
Visit a local art gallery or museum and spend extra time observing a single piece of art. Write down what you see, feel, and imagine about it.
Learn a quick new skill online, like origami, calligraphy, or a simple dance move. Celebrate the joy of learning something new!
Go stargazing in your backyard or a nearby dark-sky location. Bring a blanket and some hot chocolate for a cozy celestial experience.
Write a letter to your future self. Reflect on your current dreams, challenges, and joys. Seal it away and set a date to open it later.
Build a vision board with magazine cut-outs, photos, and drawings that represent your dreams and goals. Let it inspire you daily!
Sketch your favorite local landmark using only geometric shapes.
Visit a local market and create quick sketches of the produce and people shopping.
Take a walk in nature and gather leaves or flowers to press and use in a collage.
Write and illustrate a short, whimsical story about an imaginary creature you invent.
Visit a coffee shop and draw the cups, pastries, and people around you.
Create a blind contour drawing of your pet or a favorite animal photo.
Recreate a famous painting using items from around your home.
Walk around your neighborhood and photograph interesting textures for a mood board.
Pick a color palette and create a series of small abstract paintings or sketches.
Attend a free virtual art workshop or webinar for a fresh perspective.
Visit a botanical garden and focus on drawing or photographing unusual plants.
Spend an afternoon cutting out images from old magazines to create a vision board.
Revisit a childhood memory and create an artwork inspired by it.
Go to a bookstore and pick a random art or photography book to study.
Create a monochromatic artwork using only different shades of one color.
Draw or paint while listening to a genre of music you rarely listen to.
Find a random object in your home and create a study focusing on its textures and shadows.
Visit a thrift store and find a unique item to inspire your next piece of art.
Spend the day experimenting with a new medium you’ve never tried before.
Make an artwork inspired by your favorite movie or TV show scene.
Visit a cemetery and sketch the most intricate or unusual gravestones, imagining the stories behind them.
Visit an antique shop and create a fictional backstory for the most interesting object you find.
Spend an afternoon stargazing and sketch what you imagine the constellations might represent beyond their usual meanings.
Go to a public space and create quick character sketches or notes based on overheard conversations (without being intrusive!).
Find a location with a public piano or instrument and improvise music inspired by the setting.
Visit an animal sanctuary or petting zoo and create gesture drawings of the animals in motion.
Spend a day trying out an unconventional art material, like coffee, mud, or flower petals, to create something unique.
Attend a local trivia night and use the themes or questions as prompts for a creative project.
Sign up for a community walking tour or ghost tour and capture your experience through notes and quick sketches.
Create a ‘treasure map’ of a local park or area, marking places of personal significance or things you find intriguing.
Create a bouquet using shop-bought flowers, wildflowers, or blooms from your garden. Use it for still life studies or gift it to a neighbour.
Offer to pet-sit for someone and use the opportunity to observe, photograph, or sketch the animal’s personality and quirks.
Attend a local theatre production, then write or sketch a creative response inspired by the performance.
Visit a vintage clothing store and assemble a quirky outfit. Use it as inspiration for character design or storytelling.
Spend an afternoon at a public library, browsing random sections you wouldn’t normally explore, and sketch or write about what you discover.
Go birdwatching in your local area, taking notes or sketching the different species and their behaviours.
Host a mini film festival at home, choosing movies from a genre or country you rarely watch, and create art inspired by the visuals.
Take a pottery or ceramics class to create something functional and artistic with your hands.
Walk through your local area at sunset or sunrise and photograph the changing light and shadows.
Attend a live storytelling or poetry slam event and reflect on the stories through sketches or journaling.
